page.title: 01Castell-y-Bere & Craig-yr-Ad
page.content: The flood plain of Afon Dysynni is dominated by the majestic spandour of "Bird Rock", a formidable granite out-crop that overlooks the whole valley as it runs NE to SW. Situated further up the valley there is the strongold of Castell-y-Bere, a welsh castle that strategically commands the whole region. Much of the valley plain is set astride for sheep and cattle raising, and as usual, the smaller tributory rivers that run into the Afon Dysynni, flow down steep river valleys. Although most of the area is covered in grass and heathland, there are several sections dominated by either deciduous or coniferous trees, especially around Abergynolwyn, the only village of some size in the area. Both railway and a local bus service pass through this village.
